posts.post_content:
@evenblackerlotus : If a creature has protection from something (let's say white), it means it can't be targeted, enchanted, equipped, damaged, or blocked by anything white. Unfortunately, [Day of Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgment) does none of those five things, and so Brave the Elements won't save your guys.  
  
I know, it seems silly that Protection doesn't cover getting DESTROYED, which would seem to be the primary concern of being "protected"...but hey, that's what Wizards decided long ago. (Also, I just don't think it would feel right if a mere creature with protection from a color could live through the [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God) or the [Day of Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgment).)
posts.html:
@evenblackerlotus : If a creature has protection from something (let's say white), it means it can't be targeted, enchanted, equipped, damaged, or blocked by anything white. Unfortunately, Day of Judgment does none of those five things, and so Brave the Elements won't save your guys.

I know, it seems silly that Protection doesn't cover getting DESTROYED, which would seem to be the primary concern of being "protected"...but hey, that's what Wizards decided long ago. (Also, I just don't think it would feel right if a mere creature with protection from a color could live through the Wrath of God or the Day of Judgment.)

Posted By: Pwnsaw (10/11/2009 4:52:13 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: It's this card's versatility that makes it insanely good. First, it's a one drop counter to removal or anything else that your opponent might do to one of your creatures. Second, it can turn a disadvantaged table into a huge advantage by giving one-sided damage prevention. Just block your opponents alpha strike and laugh. Last, it's white's one-drop Overrun. Sure you don't get any bonuses to power or toughness, but you essentially get unblockable instead of that measly trample. The only problem is that the second two effects are sometimes imperfect against multi-color decks, which are obviously common in the meta. However, more often than not even against a multi-color deck most or all of your opponent's creatures share at least one color. Bottomline: this card wins games; early, mid, or late game. 5/5
posts.html:
It's this card's versatility that makes it insanely good. First, it's a one drop counter to removal or anything else that your opponent might do to one of your creatures. Second, it can turn a disadvantaged table into a huge advantage by giving one-sided damage prevention. Just block your opponents alpha strike and laugh. Last, it's white's one-drop Overrun. Sure you don't get any bonuses to power or toughness, but you essentially get unblockable instead of that measly trample. The only problem is that the second two effects are sometimes imperfect against multi-color decks, which are obviously common in the meta. However, more often than not even against a multi-color deck most or all of your opponent's creatures share at least one color. Bottomline: this card wins games; early, mid, or late game. 5/5

posts.post_content: This card is inexpensive and versatile in a deck full of white creatures. It can be used to save all of your guys from [Volcanic Fallout](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volcanic Fallout) or [Earthquake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Earthquake). You can also use it during combat to fly past your opponent's blockers. White is so powerful!
